summary: The Department of Homeland Security spends billions of dollars each year to buy goods and services. But recruiting, retaining, and managing the workforce overseeing these procurements is a challenge. Most DHS acquisition staff we interviewed said that workload was the biggest challenge. For example, some staff had to fill multiple roles because they were short-staffed or other staff lacked adequate experience. And hiring new employees...
title: Homeland Security: Actions Needed to Address Acquisition Workforce Challenges and Data
